description.narrative: (Zambia): .USAID Zambia District Coverage of Health Services (DISCOVER-Health) mechanism contributes to HIV epidemic control and provides family planning/reproductive health (FP/RH), and maternal, newborn and child health services and products to prevent mother and child deaths. The majority of the funding for this activity is supported by PEPFAR. DISCOVER-Health supports the lowest level of the healthcare system through a national network of 112 community posts and outreach services. Over the past five years, the DISCOVER-Health activity has built capacity of the health posts to provide an integrated package, including: a) comprehensive HIV services; b) service delivery and outreach activities to expand access to childhood immunizations, c) provision of reproductive health care and family planning services; and, d) activities to expand access to antenatal care. In the last year of this cooperative agreement through Dec 2021, DISCOVER-Health will focus on transitioning these health posts to the management of the Ministry of Health (MOH) to ensure the continuity of quality health services. They will focus on provision of technical assistance rather than direct service delivery. In addition, the social marketing and social behaviour change activities that had been funded under this mechanism will be transitioned to the Zam Health activity (ID104808). Under USAID's Country Development Cooperation Strategy, the mechanism will support Development Objective 3: Capacity of Zambia's Government, Citizens and Private Sector Increased to Improve Health Outcomes and Meet Critical Needs of Vulnerable Populations... .
